Effective October 1, 2021, the OPS COVID-19 Safe Workplace Directive requires all Ontario Public Service employees to provide proof they are fully vaccinated, meaning they are fully vaccinated as defined by the Ministry of Health (refer to: COVID-19 Fully Vaccinated Status in Ontario), including 14 calendar days have passed since receiving their final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

Employees who do not provide proof of full vaccination will be deemed ‘not vaccinated' under the Directive and will be required to attend a vaccine education program and undergo regular rapid antigen testing. Employees who are not vaccinated under the policy with a valid medical exemption will not be required to attend a vaccine education program but must undergo regular rapid antigen testing.

Job Description:
Bank of America is one of the world's largest financial institutions, serving individual consumers, small and middle market businesses and large corporations with a full range of banking, investing, asset management and other financial and risk-management products and services. Following the acquisition of Merrill Lynch on January 1, 2009, Bank of America is among the world's leading wealth management companies and is a global leader in corporate and investment banking and trading across a broad range of asset classes serving corporations, governments, institutions and individuals around the world. In Canada, Bank of America has a strong market position on which to continue to build, as well as a clear commitment to the market.
Job Description
Bank of America Prime Brokerage Market Risk Technology team is looking for candidates for a data/quantitative analyst role within the Multi-Asset Calculator team, which is a global team responsible for in house margin requirement calculation for PB portfolios.
The data/quantitative analyst candidate will work with the PBMRT Risk-based Margin Calculator team. The role requires in-depth knowledge of capital market reference data, financial products, risk-based financial product valuations, and prior experience with margin requirement methodology is nice to have.
Responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:
Liaise with business partners to analyze requirements
Create and track functional specification for development and testing
Perform research though internal data platforms, Bloomberg and other means for data maintenance;
Assist agile development team with analysis and resolution of production issues and user queries
Required Skills
Five (5) to seven (7) years of related work experience
Working knowledge of SQL
Proficient in data manipulation and presentation in Excel
Comfortable in an agile working environment
Prior experience in capital markets risk-based product valuation
Self-starter and proactive
What Bank of America Offers
Bank of America embodies a culture that extends from how we think, to how we behave, and to how we measure performance. By achieving excellence - in everything we do, every time we do it - we deliver the full value of Bank of America for our clients, our shareholders and our employees.
Bank of America places a high value on talent and on maintaining a culture defined by meritocracy. For these reasons, it is deeply committed to professional development, opportunity and accountability at all levels of the organization.
Bank of America is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Bank of America encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Applicants with disabilities may notify us of any accommodations needed to support your participation in the recruitment process. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying. Please be aware that only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted for this position.

Company Description
Torstar Corporation is a progressive media organization with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar’s vision for success is driven by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven. The successful candidate will be a champion of those priorities while keeping the customer at the heart of all of the creative work that s/he will be doing.

Job Description
The Data Science team at Torstar is seeking a passionate data professional to support the Digital and Marketing teams through insights and analysis, focused on the 360 view of a customer. The Data Analyst – Subscription Analytics is responsible for delivering exceptional data products that lead to subscription growth and optimal customer experiences. You possess a hybrid skillset of strong analytical depth coupled with business acumen and can leverage your skills to deliver accurate reporting, scorecards, analysis, and recommendations to various business units. You will help drive a data-first culture across the organization. This position reports to the Director, Data Science.
Responsibilities
Build and maintain key operational KPI executive dashboards, scorecards, and reports
Conduct various digital subscription, newsroom, and digital advertising analytics
Leverage the data gathered to better understand how customers find content, where they consume it, how to further optimize that experience, and drive them down the subscription funnel
Work closely with cross functional teams such as the data engineering team and business teams to ensure that data required by stakeholders is collected and reported effectively in order to help drive successful business outcomes
Understand each stakeholders’ products, KPIs, goals and challenges to bring data informed recommendations and analysis for testing offers, segmentations and marketing experiments
Prepare and present presentations to senior leaders in a non-technical way, have a high attention to detail in double checking data for accuracy, and produce detailed documentation

Qualifications

Basic knowledge of web analytics and analytics setup/configuration and experience with Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Google Analytics, Parse.ly, etc.
Advanced experience in creating visualizations through tools such as Tableau, Cognos, Power BI, and/or Mode Analytics
Technical Skills: experience with SQL, Excel, Python, R, relational databases, data warehouses
Experience with data-management systems, working with large data-sets and creating reporting surrounding the data
Knowledge of advanced analytics tools such as Data Robot, Rapid Miner, etc. is preferred
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to relay technical concepts to non-technical audiences and explain analytics with context
Excellent attention to detail and ability to organize and prioritize
Highly motivated independent worker
Additional Information

Torstar is committed to ensuring employment opportunity to qualified applicants without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, family status or disability or any other factor protected by law.

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
The Team
The Global Fraud Technology team develops and manages innovative products designed to continuously strengthen the bank’s posture against the ever-changing Fraud threat landscape. We are part of the Global Engineering and Operations Functions team and we work in close partnership with our Fraud Business and key Technology Partners throughout Scotiabank to drive implementation of global products that will protect and strengthen the bank. We work with advanced technologies and are looking for key team members that have a passion to learn and deliver.
The Role
Global Fraud Technology Team is looking for an energetic and results-oriented Data Analyst to join our team to help in continuing to build and enhance our Business Intelligence capabilities.
We’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done.
Some of the Key Accountabilities include:
Conduct discovery sessions with business teams to understand and capture their processes, formulate alternative to improve productivity using analytics and automation, and define the related key performance indicators
Take on assigned data mining, analysis, profiling, and modeling activities and complete them within competing priorities and deadlines
Devise design alternatives for ingesting data for analytics, management reports and dashboards
Complete data and access governance assessments for internal and external regulatory and legislative compliance

Contribute to the story mapping, creating user stories, and furnishing user stories with details were needed
Work closely with business stakeholders, product owner, and developers and addressing their ad-hoc data, information, and analysis requests
What You Will Bring to Succeed
You are curious and highly motivated to discover new relations in business data, understand and interpret data, tell the story of how it is used in business processes, and how to deliver business value by transforming it
You have 5-7 years extensive knowledge of business intelligence tools and programming languages
You have 5-7 years experience in working for large projects and have advanced experience with SQL, ETL, data analysis and profiling, data mapping, data modeling, data lakes, and analytics
You are excellent in written and spoken English to clearly communicate complex issues and interface with all levels of the organization with ease
You have excellent interpersonal, prioritization, and issues management skills for building strong collaborative relationships with stakeholders and coworkers
You are highly organized, disciplined, and responsive in a fast paced and demanding environment
You constantly and strongly demonstrate the core values that continuously advance the productivity of high-performing and self-organizing teams: respect, commitment, courage, openness, and focus
The Workplace
We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work

We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation

company: Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development
job_description:
Do you like to analyze data to generate insights, create data visualizations to help communicate meaning, and use data to support decision-making? If so, consider this opportunity with the Analytics Unit of the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development where you will use your skills to lead and support a range of research and analytics projects in support of the Ministry's employment and training programs.

About Us:

The Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development's Employment and Training Division contributes to a prosperous and stable economy by delivering integrated employment and training programs and services.

The division's Finance, Analysis and Systems Support Branch (FASSB) leads financial planning, corporate reporting and risk management exercises; provides a comprehensive suite of dynamic reporting and analytic products; and works with Ministry and I&IT Cluster partners to manage the development, enhancement and maintenance of the division's business information systems and digital business models. The branch offers an innovative and inclusive culture, exposure to an integrated perspective on policy and program delivery and on-going opportunities for managers and staff to develop new skills and competencies.

At FASSB, we recognize that flexibility is vital. We take our work seriously and want to enjoy doing it! We embrace and celebrate differences. We look for diversity and inclusion when we hire top talent. We have great respect for our strengths, perspectives, opinions and lifestyles. We have high expectations of each other, but even higher expectations of ourselves. We love the clash of ideas that lead to better solutions. Challenging the status quo is encouraged. Collaborating will allow us to push forward. If this sounds like a good fit for you, come and join us!

What can I expect to do in this role?
In this Research Analyst role you will:

conduct and/or lead research, statistical analysis, mapping and reporting on Ontario socioeconomic, demographic and labour market conditions;analyze data from a variety of sources to make comparisons, identify relationships, and determine the trends and implications for employment and training programs;develop a range of analytical reports, maps, datasets, products and tools for staff across the division to support division business planning, program and policy development and to track service trends using the latest analytical tools and techniques;provide analytics advice and prepare a range of reports and briefing materials for use by senior management;liaise with other branches and ministries to discuss research and respond to inquiries;represent the unit/branch/ministry on working groups and committees
How do I qualify?
Specialized KnowledgeYou have knowledge of economics, statistical analysis and research methodologies, data modelling, and quality assurance techniques and practices to produce reports, conduct research projects and assess data models and analyses of socio-economic and demographic trends and issues.You can interpret relevant legislation and guidelines and understand trends and critical issues related to employment and training programs and services in Ontario.
Technical SkillsYou have knowledge of and skills in data warehousing and variable definitions, information/database management and business planning and analysis methods, processes, systems and applications to conduct analytics, aggregations, data mining and analysis, evaluate program performance and ensure and assess data accuracy and integrity.You have experience using analytics tools and technology (Power BI), statistical modelling and forecasting-specific software (e.g. R, Python, SQL) and mapping software tools.You have experience using standard computer software (e.g. MS Office).
Project Management, Analytical and Research SkillsYou have project management to plan, lead and coordinate projects and to contribute to multi-disciplinary, cross-ministry project teams.You have demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills to identify key trends and issues, interpret research results and make recommendations.
Communication, Presentation, Consultation and Relationship-Management SkillsYou have effective oral and written communications and presentation skills to respond to information requests, to prepare reports and briefing materials, and to communicate complex data/information in a user-friendly fashion.You have consultation and relationship management skills to develop relationships, assess client needs and exchange information.

Job Details

Appcast is looking for an independent self-starter who will help customers bridge the gap between what the data outputs are and how to use them. The key team member will work alongside our sales and customer success teams to produce and deliver customer and benchmark data.

Collaborating with members from various teams, you will participate in the planning, execution, and presentations of benchmark and customer data directly to customers.

What you’ll be working on
Data, Data & More Data – we use data in many parts of the business – and we need you to take it from raw data (in excel) and transform it into easy to understand stories through graphs and descriptions for sales, marketing, strategy & customers
Customer Quarterly Business Reviews– we need you to pull together the customer’s data and industry benchmark data to help customers understand their performance and areas for improvement. You will then present that data to leaders of some of the largest employers in the US.
Interesting Data for our Content – we use data in our benchmark and other reports – and we need you to help us organize it and find the interesting parts to share.


Desired Qualifications
Extremely detail-oriented
Experience in a customer-facing job
Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as presentation skills
A degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, finance, business, computer science or other analytics-focused major
Above average skills with excel and PowerPoint
Experience with SQL, Tableau, and/or Google Data Studios is a plus


Why Appcast?

Inc. Magazine named us a Best Workplaces for 2021!
We’re the best at what we do. We’re the global leader in programmatic recruitment advertising. With advanced technology, unmatched market data and a team of the industry’s best recruitment marketers, Appcast’s technology and services manage over half a billion dollars in job advertising annually on behalf of more than 1,500 clients.

We have an amazing culture driven by great people. HQ in Lebanon, N.H. with offices in Boston, MA, New Brunswick, Canada and Minsk, Belarus, Appcast is a subsidiary of StepStone, one of the world’s largest job classified businesses, and a proud member of the Axel Springer SE family. To better understand our company culture, read Our Story and check out Working at Appcast on our website.

We take care of our employees. We also are focused on being a place where smart, driven people of all backgrounds and experiences want to come to work and have opportunities to learn and grow. We pay our employees well and offer an exceptional, all-inclusive benefits package so that our employees can take care of their families and each other. We like to get together and have fun, we like to have great food and snacks in our offices, we like to volunteer and give back to our communities, and we like bringing dogs to our offices.

General information
Agency: Initiative
Job Function: Data & Analytics
Location: Toronto, Canada
Job Ref#: 9015
Description & Requirements
Position Summary
This role provides a unique opportunity to use your analytics and data skills in the marketing industry. We are looking for someone who is passionate about pulling insights out of the data; someone who is experienced with reporting and data visualization.
The role of a Data Analyst is to provide reporting and analytics for some of our more complex clients and their diverse marketing portfolio. Some of the data you’ll be working with include social media data, display and video programmatic buys, site data and market research data. You will play a key role in driving an ongoing learning agenda and fostering a data driven decision making process, working collaboratively with various internal partners and client teams.
Key Responsibilities
Use analytical skills and business acumen to provide data and analysis to assist in solving marketing problems
Leverage the use of technology for data processing and workflow automation
Maintain and update client dashboards in Tableau, Datorama, Domo, Data Studio or any other BI platform
Lead campaign reporting process and deliverables, establishing the standards for how campaign results are delivered to clients.
Collaborate with the media planning team and campaign team to uncover meaningful insights and develop client relevant recommendations.
Analyze data to recommend campaign execution and visualization improvements, based on data and observed trends
Manage QA process and data governance for our internal data warehouse solution
Create performance forecasts and track actual performance against forecasted plans
Desired Skills & Experience
2-3 years of experience in a data analytics or reporting role
Demonstrated proficiency in Google Sheets, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, SQL, and Python
Experience with using Tableau, Domo, Google Data Studio, Datorama or any other BI visualization platforms
Familiarity with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics exposure
Strong communication skills (verbal & written); ability to provide concise, clear reporting and actionable analysis
Proven ability to self-check work to ensure results are error-free
Keenness to learn new skills, platforms and technologies
Travel or tourism industry exposure highlight valued
Experience in marketing and/or media performance (digital experience desired)
Familiarity with social media marketing and programmatic media channels
Familiarity with Marketing Mix Modeling and/or econometrics
High-level knowledge of media attribution
Familiarity with Marketing, Business KPIs, Benchmarks and KPI correlation, Brand Lift Study and Measurement Research
Audience Segmentation, Targeting and Analytics experience
BS/BA in Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Marketing or similar field, or any relevant/applicable experience
About Us
Initiative is different to other media agencies.


We are not trapped by a legacy structure primarily centered on paid advertising. Instead, we are liberated by a new world structure designed to deliver highly differentiated and highly effective communications strategies for our clients. 

We’re not the biggest agency in town. So rather than outsize our competitors we must outsmart them. That’s why we’ve built the strongest strategic capability of any agency in the market. Core to this strategic capability is an obsession with culture and how brands can pivot from brand advertising (which is forgettable) to cultural branding (which is memorable). 

Our new world model is comprised of four central “craft centers” – Client Advice and Management, Strategy, Communications Design and Partnerships. 

OUR BEHAVIORS 

Initiative respects that everyone has something unique to contribute to the agency. 

We are a bunch of eclectic and brilliant misfits with diverse backgrounds that represent the unique fabric of consumers and culture. 

We want you to be yourself. We want to hear your opinions. We want to see your passion and energy. 

If you disagree with something you see or hear then speak up. We will never punish or penalize you for bringing something important to our attention. 

If you believe you can improve something in the agency then speak up. We will always listen to your ideas and suggestions. 

We will not tolerate harassment, bullying or corporate politics. We will not tolerate discrimination of any kind. We expect you to be responsible on social media and remember that you represent the agency and should not bring us into disrepute. 

We are committed to your learning and development. The agency will organize regular training to enhance and accelerate your career – we expect you to prioritize training and actively participate. 

We strive for world-class work on every client, every time. 

We believe that good enough is not good enough.

Important note : As this posting is for the recruitment of a position at a specific Fujitsu client who requires COVID-19 full vaccination as a condition to assignment, please note COVID-19 full vaccination (along with acceptable proof of vaccination) is a condition of employment of this position at Fujitsu. Any requests for exceptions will be coordinated with the client in accordance with its policies.
Fujitsu at a Glance
Fujitsu is a leading information and communication technology (ICT) company, headquartered in Japan, offering a full range of technology products, solutions, and services. Approximately 132,000 Fujitsu people support customers in more than 100 countries. We use our experience and the power of ICT to shape the future of society with our customers.
We are a corporate culture that places great value on the pursuit of new possibilities previously unimagined and brings them to fruition. This has been the foundation of Fujitsu’s success since its inception. In an increasingly competitive world, in which the pace of change continues to accelerate, Fujitsu must strive for continuous innovation. Each and every employee will rise to the challenge of creating new value amid changes in the management environment, technology, society and the marketplace. With a spirit of challenge, we are committed to the continuous creation of new value. Fujitsu wants innovators like you!
At Fujitsu, one of our corporate principles is "We respect human rights." This principle underpins all our corporate and individual activities and guides the actions of every Fujitsu Group member. We embrace diversity and equal opportunity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, political belief, social condition, family, marital or civil status, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or conviction of an offence that is unrelated to employment. By empowering people, we can unleash our collective strengths to create a better experience for our employees, our customers, and our partners .

job_title: Policy and Data Analyst - Careers for Persons with Disabilities
job_description:
Government of Canada - Various

Various locations

EC-01, EC-02, EC-03, EC-04, EC-05

$54,746 to $100,492 (plus health insurance, dental care, and vacation allowances)
For further information on the organization, please visit Government of Canada
Need help with your application? Check out our video for tips and advice!
Are you a member of the persons with disabilities' employment equity group?
Closing date: 31 March 2022 - 23:59, Pacific Time
Who can apply: Persons residing in Canada, and Canadian citizens and Permanent residents abroad
AND
who self-declare as persons with disabilities.

Apply online
Important messages
The Government of Canada strives to be representative of the population it serves in all its diversity, and is committed to hiring over 5 000 people with disabilities by 2025 in a variety of fields across the federal public service.

We’re committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. To request accommodation measures or adjustments during any phase of this process and for any questions, contact us at cfp.monprochainemploi-mynextjob.psc@canada.ca. Any information you provide in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

By submitting an application, you’re applying to an inventory for future positions, rather than a specific job. As positions become available, applicants who meet the qualifications may be contacted for further assessment.
INFORMATION SESSION ON HOW TO APPLY

Discover how the Government of Canada Policy and Data Career Opportunities contribute to enhancing legislative frameworks, programs and services that matter to Canadians! Register for our information session by contacting us at cfp.monprochainemploi-mynextjob.psc@canada.ca


If you’re already qualified in an EC-01, EC-02, EC-03, EC-04 or EC-05 pool, please let us know when prompted to do so.
Duties
Policy and Data Careers in the public service are as varied as the number of departments and agencies in the Government of Canada.

You could be working on:

DATA ANALYSIS
research, studies, forecasts and surveyseconomic or sociological effects of departmental or interdepartmental projects, programs and policiesdeveloping, analyzing and interpreting qualitative and quantitative information and socio-economic policies and recommendations
POLICY ANALYSIS:
developing policies on guiding government investment programs and economic development activitiesparticipating in consultations and exploring various models to support government prioritiesdeveloping strategic advice with regard to federal efforts
Work environment
The Government of Canada’s priorities are reflected in the policies that guide federal departments and agencies in delivering on their mandates. Let your areas of interest guide your career progression in a collaborative work environment with leaders such as Statistics Canada; Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada; the Public Health Agency of Canada; and many others.

Your analytical expertise and passion for understanding the impacts of policies and socio-economic variables on programs, projects and services that impact Canadians is vital to all departments and agencies.

Once you’ve been hired, workplace adjustments will give you the opportunity to fully use your competencies at work. Tools like the Accessibility Passport will help you and your manager identify and implement what you need to do your job.
Intent of the process
The intent of this process is to recruit people with disabilities with a variety of policy or data analysis expertise on behalf of the Government of Canada.


Whether you’re at the start of your career or a professional with several years of experience, this opportunity applies to you.
Positions to be filled: 150
Information you must provide
Your résumé.
In order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)
EDUCATION
Positions require a bachelor's degree with acceptable specialization in Economics, Sociology or Statistics, obtained OR that will be obtained by June 30, 2022. If you think that you have the specialization through a combination of education, training and experience, share this information in your application.
Degree equivalency
If you possess any of the following, your application must also clearly explain how you meet it (other qualifications)
ABOUT THE APPLICATION PROCESS
The first step is to share information through your application about your education and experience relating to the areas that are of interest to you such as:

Policy analysis of socio-economic, demographic or environmental issuesData production and analysisThe use of analytical and statistical tools.
You are not expected to have experience in all fields.

This is your opportunity to give context to your experience for the hiring manager. Your resume may be used as a secondary source of information to validate your answers.


Depending on the position being staffed, certain operational requirements such as shift work and/or conditions of employment could apply (e.g. security clearance).
The following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)
Various language requirements
You can apply for English, French or Bilingual (English and French) positions.
Information on language requirements
Second Language Writing Skills Self-Assessment
In order to help you decide if you should apply to a bilingual position, an optional self-assessment of your writing skills in your second official language is available for you to take before completing your application.
For more information, please consult:
Unsupervised Internet Test of Second Language Writing Skills
COMPETENCIES
Reasoning
JudgmentOther competencies may be required and assessed by the hiring organization.
Some examples of what could be assessed are:
Analytical thinking
Effective communication
Effective people skills and collaborationShowing initiative and being action-orientedDemonstrating integrity and respect
The following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)
Selection is limited to persons with disabilities and could also be limited to women, visible minorities and Indigenous.
Information on employment equity
Conditions of employment
All employees of the core public administration are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and attest to their vaccination status unless accommodated based on a medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act.
Tests
Applicants must successfully write Public Service Entrance Exam (PSEE).
Other information
Feel free to apply and communicate with us in the official language of your choice.

ABOUT THE ASSESSMENT PROCESS

You’ll be assessed to ensure that you meet the qualifications of these positions. This includes a review of the information you provided in this application and may include a standardized test, a self-assessment, an interview and reference checks.


When managers consider your candidacy, they may ask you for more information specific to the position being staffed before making a final decision.


At every step, from the application process to the end of the assessment process, accommodation measures or adjustments are available to you.


Tell us what you need. Examples include: accessible environments, different formats, larger fonts, adaptive technology, extra time, individual testing, and more.


Accommodation measures are designed to remove barriers to a fair assessment and allow candidates to fully demonstrate their competencies. For additional information regarding assessment accommodation, please consult: https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/services/assessment-accommodation-page.html.

To request accommodation measures or adjustments, and for any question about the process, contact us at cfp.monprochainemploi-mynextjob.psc@canada.ca.

COVID-19 IMPACT

Our workplaces have temporary or permanent measures in place to ensure the health and safety of employees as well as the continuity of operations. Don’t hesitate to discuss these measures and other workplace flexibilities such as telework and work location with the hiring manager for a specific job opportunity.
REGARDING THE REQUIREMENT TO BE VACCINATED:

On October 6, 2021, the Government of Canada announced details of its plans to require vaccination across the federal public service.

As per the new Policy on COVID-19 Vaccination for the Core Public Administration Including the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, federal public servants in the Core Public Administration and members of the RCMP must attest to their vaccination status. The requirement for employees to be fully vaccinated applies whether they are teleworking, working remotely or working on-site. This is a condition of employment and it applies to indeterminate (permanent), determinate (term), casual, and student hiring. Should you reach the point in the selection process where it is necessary to verify terms and conditions of employment then the hiring manager or a human resources representative will contact you in order to complete an attestation.
Preference
Preference will be given to veterans first and then to Canadian citizens and permanent residents, with the exception of a job located in Nunavut, where Nunavut Inuit will be appointed first.
Information on the preference to veterans
We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts is a global, luxury hotel management company. We manage over 100 hotels and resorts and 44 private residences in 45 countries around the world and growing. At Four Seasons, we are powered by people and our culture enables everything we do.
The Analyst, ESG Data and Reporting will support the company’s ESG efforts by compiling, managing and analyzing key ESG metrics across the business. The Analyst will prepare data and dashboards that will be used for both internal and external purposes, to drive progress towards the company’s forthcoming ESG goals. The Analyst will play a critical role in supporting Four Seasons external ESG reporting and achievement of the company’s ESG objectives.
This role is based in Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts, Toronto Corporate Office, reporting to the Manager, ESG Programs. This role involves interactions with internal and external stakeholders at various levels.
Key Activities
Manage, review, cleanse and analyze ESG data captured in Four Seasons’ data systems.
Facilitate ESG measurement and management, to enable the company to track progress towards our forthcoming ESG goals.
Oversee day-to-day management and evolution of Four Seasons’ environmental data platform.
Continually improve our data systems and programs to enhance our ESG management capabilities.
Manage internal leadership dashboards for tracking and reporting progress towards Four Seasons’ ESG goals.
Support the creation of business-relevant internal reporting and training, including graphics and dashboards for regions and departments to help them track progress towards ESG goals.
Prepare data for inclusion in internal and external reporting, including internal leadership dashboards, annual external reporting, and ESG questionnaires.
Facilitate business-relevant, transparent reporting of ESG performance metrics, to drive internal awareness/engagement and external communications. Develop impactful leadership dashboards that align with financial reporting processes.
Work with third-party providers to obtain assurance over ESG data prior to publication.
Ensure the accuracy of our data to facilitate external reporting.
Support Four Seasons’ global ESG efforts on ad-hoc projects, including implementation of environmental pilot projects at our hotels.
Facilitate business-relevant, transparent reporting of ESG performance metrics, to drive internal awareness/engagement and external communications. Develop impactful leadership dashboards that align with financial reporting processes.
Assist with program deployment and interactions with properties. Assist the SME and vendor partners with communications and change management at property level. Create tools and resources for the properties.
Desired Skills
Superior analytical skills; able to perform advanced statistical analysis of data; inquisitive and able to identify key variables, drivers for change and discover the root cause.
Self-starter with a personal growth mindset
Solution-oriented with ability to assess situations and exercise good judgment
Exceptional project management and collaboration skills; detail-oriented and organized
Ability to work across global, virtual, and cross-functional teams
Strong communications skills and ability to deliver the results of findings for management
Experience, Education and Professional Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required.
Track record of strong analytics, project management, and communications required.
Experience handling and analyzing environmental impact metrics, reporting and measurement, particularly carbon and energy management
Familiarity with the engineering requirements of buildings, EPA EnergyStar Portfolio Manager benchmarking tool and similar, and business intelligence and data visualization tools preferred
All internal applications must be submitted and approved in Workday by March 3, 2022.
Four Seasons is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

About us

We are a digital design agency and a certified B Corp based in Vancouver, BC.
Our mission is to partner with organizations who see their business as a force for sustainable growth and positive impact for their employees, for their customers, and for the cultures and environments they influence. We tell stories and craft digital experiences that engage, energize, and impact people.
All Purpose was founded in 2017 as a multidisciplinary business that has quickly grown. Our teams include visual designers, brand strategists, UX engineers, developers, digital marketers, illustrators, video producers, editors, storytellers, project managers, animators, and researchers.
In order to support our mission, we are looking for a Freelance Digital Analyst, who will be responsible for tracking the digital activity on various platforms and giving insights to the relevant teams to improve and optimize programs. In this role you will be taking care of development of dashboard, monitoring reports and performance analysis using available tools.

We are open to candidates working remotely within core hours of 9am-5pm PST.
You will

Design, set up and maintain a digital dashboard including the KPIs needed by the different channels within the Digital team.
Prepare, monitor and share insights in the form of timely reports. You will plan KPIs, analyze results, report on key metrics and optimize future programs based on data driven learnings as well as monitor overall Digital Analytics related to all channels and programs using qualitative as well as quantitative tools.
Analyze digital data, prepare reports and share insights on trends and new activities and work closely with the Regional/OC Digital Analytics team, Business Development Planning, Market Research and Analytics team to develop digital insights.
Provide insights to stream and project leads helping with decision making relating to systems and processes enhancements as well as work on ad-hoc projects. You will be responsible for enhancements within new data analytics tools impacting digital KPIs in order to provide more clarity and data driven insights.
Other duties as requested by management related to the company mission and vision

You have or you are

Experience solving problems in the project’s business domain.
Understanding of the business requirements so as to formulate the problems to solve and restrict the slice of data to be explored.
Experience with data integration from multiple sources (Shopify, meta business)
Proficiency in at least one query language, especially SQL.
Thorough experience and understanding of Google Analytics, search console
Great communication skills.

We offer

A flexible working schedule
Meaningful impactful work as a certified social impact organization (B Corp)
An inclusive workplace with resources deployed to improving Justice, Equity, Diversity & Inclusion (JEDI)
We are a certified Pride at Work Canada partner
We are grateful to be located in the traditional, ancestral and unceded territories of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish) and səl̓ílwətaʔɬ (Tseil-Waututh) Nations.

Essential Job Functions As a key member of a strategic project team: Collaborates with development team and business stakeholders to elicit, analyze and groom business and technical requirements for large projects in an Agile Scrum environment.Creates and breaks down User Stories; aligns to business capabilities; defines acceptance criteria; and supplements with necessary data models on projects with heavy systems and data integration.Analyzes business processes and technical requirements to identify data needs and sources; prepares source to target data mapping; defines business rules to support ETL workflows; consults with development team to formalize approach for loading data.Contributes and/or reviews logical and conceptual data models to help determine and recommend optimal solutions with consideration for stakeholder and systems impacts.Facilitates and/or participates in Sprint planning sessions to create high-level Feature requirements and incorporate into Product Backlog based on dependencies and priority.Analyzes functional requirements including business processes; business rules; and exception processing, as needed.Reviews and validates requirements with stakeholders to ensure alignment with business objectives and also with system architecture / design solutions.Supports those doing testing, quality assurance and user acceptance efforts to ensure delivered solution meets acceptance criteria.Supports change management and implementation efforts by working with teams responsible for user training, procedural documents, and user support.Preferred Skills and AbilitiesExperience writing business & technical requirements for integration services between back-end mainframe architecture and enterprise applications.Business Analyst level understanding of data models, database structure and concepts, data warehouse, ETL layers, and SQL desired.BA experience with Agile Scrum methodology required.Business Analyst experience in the insurance or financial industry a plus.Working knowledge of BABOK framework and/or CBAP certification desired.Familiarity using ALM requirements tools such as TFS, JIRA, a plus.Other certifications such as PMP, BPM, Six Sigma, Lean, a plus.Proficiency with MS-Office applications: Excel, Word, Visio, PowerPoint, etc, required.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentPay: From $110,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayWork remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Flexiti is one of Canada’s fastest growing fintech lenders. We aim to make our customers’ lives more affordable and help our retail partners grow their sales by offering flexible financing options. Through our award-winning omni-channel platform, customers can be approved instantly to shop with their FlexitiCard®, which they can use online or in-store to make multiple purchases, within their credit limit, without needing to reapply.


At Flexiti, we work hard, we love what we do, and we have some fun along the way! If you are looking for an energizing and innovative work environment with great people and big ideas, we’d love to have you join us!


To learn more about Flexiti, please visit www.flexiti.com


Data Integrations Analyst:

The Data Integrations Analyst will support data engineering and data operations with tasks within our file exchange ecosystem to deliver seamless cross platform integrations and mapping for file exchange processes. This individual will help build and support data engineering solutions, as well as support the administration, maintenance and troubleshooting the MFT platform. They will work under the direction of the Data Integration Manager and provide trouble resolution, serving as a backup point of escalation on complex MFT problems.


What you will be doing:
Author and maintain documentation of MFT Operations and outputs as well as write technical procedures.
Collaborate with IT teams, product owners, and data analytics teams to understand data consumers' needs and implement solutions
Maintain data extracts within an evolving file transfer environment for Marketing, Risk and Operations needs.
Analyze business, IT and data requirements, and contribute to the design and implementation of the best possible MFT and ETL processes.
Work with internal teams to develop and enhance MFT solutions as well as extend its components, services and infrastructure for cross platform integration
Configure and direct complex workflows utilizing scripting, and APIs for multi-tenant file exchange services
Maintain and troubleshoot file exchanges for core business processes as well as related service configurations and settings.
Work with SRE and Enterprise support to monitor file transmissions and ensure environment running within SLAs
Adhere to process governance, security and compliance across all file exchange ecosystems
Identify root causes of data integrity issues within the MFT platform and ability to eliminate them

Title: Health Analyst, Outbreak Response and Support
Department: Health Protection, Operations and Response
Job ID: 22-0049
Organizational Overview
Great people, exceptional teams building a stronger Public Health Ontario.
We are Public Health Ontario (PHO). We live our values as a shared promise to each other, our clients and our partners. We value credibility, innovation, responsiveness, collaboration, integrity and respect. With our partners in Ontario's health system, we monitor and address the needs of the population by providing the scientific evidence and expert guidance that shapes policies and practices for a healthier Ontario. With locations across Ontario, we are working to ensure that Ontario has the strongest public health system in the world so that every day Ontarians wake up in one of the safest places to live in the world.
For more information about PHO, visit www.publichealthontario.ca
Position Details-
Position Title: Health Analyst
Department: Health Protection, Operations and Response
Location: 661 University Avenue, Toronto ON
Duration: Full-time, permanent
Hours of work: Full-time, 36.25 hours per week
Compensation Group: AMAPCEO
Salary: $61,866 to $86,614 per year
Posting Date: February 23, 2022
Closing Date: March 9, 2022
Internal candidates will be considered first
All new PHO employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire in accordance with Public Health Ontario's Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, unless they are exempt on the basis of medical or other grounds pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
Position Summary-
Reporting to the Manager, Outbreak Response and Support, the position is to provide a range of data collection, collation and analyses to support the data needs of the team, department, PHO and stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities-
Maintains electronic access to data holdings, information systems and appropriate interfaces to ensure an organized and clean file structure of the PHO's large datasets.
Writes and executes computer programs for data extraction, data set creation and analysis using spreadsheets and statistical software packages (e.g., Excel, SAS).
Conducts the routine analysis of large data sets for the interpretation and production of basic population health assessment and surveillance reports.
Analyzes, interprets and reports health data using appropriate methods in response to inquiries from within PHO and external stakeholders.
Prepares and disseminates health status and surveillance information in various formats including reports, charts, graphs and maps.
Provides support during outbreak investigations, including database development, data management, data quality and regular reporting, as needed.
Supports Department's data quality assurance efforts through the application of proven analytical approaches to identify errors or limitations in the data and to improve data validity.
Maintains contact with database and analysis experts within the broader public health system to keep up to date in the area of data quality, data management and analysis and related technologies.
Works with the epidemiologists and others on the team to assist in developing data set creation plans and analysis plans which require access to different public health data holdings.
Completes program and project documentation according to applicable standards and guidelines.
Contributes to the ongoing development of standard operation procedures for data set creation, analysis and reporting.
Contributes to the identification of optimum methods for analysis and assists in the interpretation of data.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge and Skills-
Skilled in the use of data sets, spreadsheets and databases using software such as Excel, Cognos ReportNet (CRN) and SAS.
Familiarity with public health information systems such as the Intergrated Public Health Information System (iPHIS) and ability to work with large data sets and utilize a range of information systems.
Knowledge of population health indicators, epidemiological concepts, public health research, statistical analysis, health analytic methods, and techniques to analyze data, including trend analysis, and ability to work with content experts to define their data needs would be an asset.
Knowledge of stakeholder groups, ability to build public health, research, academic, institutional, and professional networks; and working at the local, provincial/territorial, and/or federal levels would be an asset.
Knowledge of, and skills in effective time management methods and techniques to plan, develop data set creation and analysis plans for projects.
Knowledge of current public health issues related to enteric, zoonotic and vector-borne diseases.
Education and Experience-
Bachelor's degree in health sciences, biostatistics or equivalent combination of education and related experience.
Knowledge of database design, health analytics, and public health methods and data analysis techniques with approximately 2 years of experience in the collection, collation, analysis and interpretation of health data.
Attributes and Competencies-
Effective oral communication to discuss detailed data and analytic needs in response to enquiries regarding health data and related information systems from management and staff across the PHO.
Written communication skills to respond to data requests and prepare summary statistical analyses based on data findings.
Ability to work within the parameters of existing protocols for data manipulation, analysis, storage and privacy protection.
Proficiency in determining the appropriate syntax within statistical program (i.e. SAS) necessary to develop and undertake queries and problem solve or troubleshoot when syntax or software is not performing.
Identifies which of the range of available data sets are best used to access and manipulate in order to meet data needs.
Interpretation information needs into analytical procedures.

Support Data Analyst (Python)
Remote: Canada
#LI-remote

Why We Need You – The Mission

ATP is a global information services and software company that exists to make flying safer and more reliable. We are back by two private equity firms—Accel-KKR and Parker Gale—both with a strong history of growth. Our products help reduce operating costs, improve aircraft reliability, and supports technical knowledge sharing and collaboration within the general and business aviation, military/defense, commercial aviation, and OEM industries. We have deployed solutions for multiple Fortune 100 companies, supporting more than 75,000 aircraft maintenance professionals worldwide. As a global company, ATP has more than 7,500 customers in 137 countries, with nearly 50 years of experience in the information services and software industries.

The ChronicX product provides an innovative approach for detecting and managing recurring defects. ChronicX identifies, consolidates, and ranks recurring and potential chronic defects across aircraft fleets, regardless of the aircraft. It is currently in use on 25% of the world’s commercial airline fleet.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for working with customers' IT departments to implement data feeds from their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with our product – which performs knowledge extraction from these data feeds using a variety of Natural Language Processing algorithms backed by general, industry-specific, and customer-specific dictionaries and word lists. The successful candidate will manage and adjust these dictionaries to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives.

What You’ll Accomplish - Your Performance Objectives

Performance Objective #1:
Within your first 30 days, work with ChronicX team to build a solid understanding of the data sets required for onboarding and maintaining customers. Perform ongoing application data monitoring and analysis for proactive customer support Identify and resolve incidents through ticketing system and provide business support Perform data analysis on large and technical datasets

Performance Objective #2
Within your first 6 months, successfully onboard new customers while maintaining current customers through monitoring and support. Work with the customer’s IT department to implement data integration with their existing systems and to cleanse those data feeds for use with ChronicX Learn (or apply existing knowledge of) SQL and Python programming to write and maintain data processing and cleansing scripts used during customer data import into CX Work on deployment procedures of our products to the customers Work with and attend status meetings with ChronicX customers to support users and identify possible improvements to their instances

Performance Objective #3
Within your first 12 months, innovate and improve current business processes and configurations. Provide suggestions for product improvement to the ChronicX development team, supporting continuous improvement and optimization of the onboarding toolset used by analysts and the ChronicX algorithms. Manage and adjust configurations for ChronicX to tweak algorithm performance and eliminate missed incidents and false positives Data analysis and development to support the setup, deployment, evaluation, and customization, and go-live of SaaS web application Consult and influence design of business processes. Identify process improvements. i.e. customer training, customer experience and customer support.

Who We’re Looking For - The Personal Competencies That Matter

Technical Skills: You have experience working in Python
 You have experience with s/FTP, AWS and SaaS web applications You have experience with SQL relational databases and capable of writing SQL statements and procedures You have good understanding of data gathering, processing and validation You have experience with Jira and Confluence You have knowledge of Java and an understanding for debugging You have experience in Natural Language processing (Regular Expressions) and text data processing

Interpersonal Skills:
Success in this role requires excellent analytical abilities with a keen eye for details to easily identify errors. You should have a technical competency to identify, investigate and resolve complex, technical issues. You must thrive in working in a fast paced environment and have a proven history of delivering top tier customer service. A successful candidate is a team player who has a strong sense of ownership and accountability for their work.

Project Management & Organizational Planning:
The best candidate will have excellent project and time management skills. You do exceptionally well at multitasking and juggling several tasks at once. You will be responsible for maintaining and prioritizing your own queue, so you must excel at planning, executing and closing all projects on or before deadlines.

How we work – The Core Values that Define Our Culture
 One ATP: By thinking beyond myself, my department, my product Find a Better Way: For today and tomorrow (when we are twice the current size!) Assume Positive Intent: Through interactions, healthy conflict, opportunities and different points of view Driven to Exceed: We take pride in our work and exceeding expectations.

Tucows (NASDAQ:TCX, TSX:TC) is possibly the biggest Internet company you've never heard of. We started as a simple shareware site in 1993 and have grown into a stable of businesses; mobile, internet and domains.

"TUCOWS - OUR STORY"

We embrace a people-first philosophy that is rooted in respect, trust, and flexibility. We believe that whatever works for our employees is what works best for us. It's also why the majority of our roles are remote-first, meaning you can work from anywhere you can connect to the internet!

Today, close to a thousand people work in over 16 countries to help us make the Internet better. If this sounds exciting to you, join the herd!
About the opportunity

This is a completely remote opportunity within Canada and USA.

Tucows is looking to add a Data Analyst to our Analytics, Insights and Reporting team, reporting to the Head of Analytics & Insights. Together, we're responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, and related business intelligence operations within our quickly growing company. We've got a lot of data, and we're looking for someone to help us get the most out of it.

You will work with business, product, and engineering stakeholders to understand their needs and priorities, as well as to collaborate and ensure that their reporting requirements are captured in the development process. You'll then work with Data Engineers to build data pipelines, acquiring data from source systems and moving it through our data hierarchy, from messy and raw to clean and aggregated. Lastly, you'll explore the data with visualization tools and statistical techniques to help make our products better and to improve the experience of our customers.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Deliver reporting and analytics solutions to the business, mainly in Looker
Understand business needs and technical requirements to meet those needs
Troubleshoot variances in reports, and strive to eliminate them at the source
Help the business make data-driven decisions
Key Skills and Experience:
Top-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills
Excellent problem solving skills
3+ years experience handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reports
Strong expertise with an SQL language, database structures and data lake architectures
Nice to Have:
Experience with Looker
Experience with Snowflake
Education:
Post-secondary education in a technical field, or B.S./M.S.

About KOHO
KOHO is a quickly scaling FinTech company backed by leading investors and advisors from around the world. We started KOHO because we believe in doing two things:
Democratizing access to the best financial products and giving everyone a great financial foundation.
Since our journey began 6 years ago, we’ve raised more than $340M, grown the KOHO Collective to over 250 employees, and created accounts for more than 600,000 Canadians.
About the Role
KOHO is looking for Data Analysts (intermediate and senior-level) to drive in-quarter and long-term business growth through empowering data-driven decision making and uncovering opportunities to grow company-wide business outcomes. This is the role for you if you love automating reports, developing dashboards, and analyzing data to derive actionable insights. You’ll spend a lot of your time writing SQL queries, developing Python scripts, and consulting with business-side team members.
What You'll Do
You will study current data sources to develop accurate reporting
You will develop and present dashboards that highlight results and trends
You will conduct deep-dive analysis into business questions across your owned domain
You will scope and prioritize incoming data requests within your workflow
You will coordinate with other data team members on team projects and preserve our data warehouse as the source of truth at KOHO
You will collaborate across the firm, acting as a trusted advisor for stakeholders


Who You Are
You have 2+ years of experience in a data analyst role (seniority dependent on experience)
You are comfortable manipulating datasets with SQL (familiar with self-joins, window functions, parameters), and have intermediate Python knowledge (user-defined functions, creating API requests, writing efficient loops)
You have strong quantitative and analytical competency combined with data gathering skills
You are a quick study on business concepts, metrics, and KPIs
You have a sense of ownership and the ability to multitask and prioritize multiple assignments
You are well organized and have effective time management skills
A bonus if you have experience or an interest in any of the following!
Git
Financial industry experience
Joining the (lovely!) KOHO Team
We invest time and resources into making sure KOHO is as good as the people we hire. Here are some of the reasons we attract the best people:
Balance Your Life - Generous PTO, generous vacation, and a lifestyle spending accountWork Anywhere - Permanently remote and $1,000 to set up your home officeLevel Up - Access to an in-house certified performance coachReach Your Goals - Salary assessments twice a year, annual training allowanceThe KOHO Culture - We have won 6 "Great Place to Work ®" awards since 2019
The KOHO culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspectives. We are committed to building and fostering an inclusive, accessible environment for everyone. If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding accessibility needs, please contact peopleaccessibility@koho.ca and the People and Culture team will be happy to help.

Ready to join our team?

Xerris is a cloud-native software development company. We build amazing solutions for our customers, using agile delivery while having fun while we do it. Our specialization and service offerings include Integration and Microservice Development, Cloud Migration and Optimization, Front-End Development, Data & Analytics, Machine Learning and DevOps.


We are a remote-first environment as we believe you can be most productive when you are given full control of where you are in the world. You will be joining a strong culture of mentorship, where mentorship-oriented leaders guide employees to improve their skills and support their development. No matter what level of experience you're at, there is always something new to learn in the cloud.
What we are looking for

We are looking for two Business Analysts (contract) to join our team of skilled technical professionals and leaders to deliver high quality products and services to our customers. This individual must be an effective communicator as this position requires close collaboration with the client and stakeholders.

Relationship Management
Develop and maintain relationships with other functional teams to ensure smooth delivery of releases
Ensure appropriate collaboration within the Product Team and across groups outside of the team to ensure our collective success
Support & Coordination
Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
Lead workshops to gather and analyze requirements and construct workflow charts and diagrams; study system capabilities; write specifications
Clearly document and organize technical requirements through writing and updating stories in the Product Backlog
Commit to focus to deliver initiatives and items prioritized in the Product Backlog
Responsible to ensure standardized processes are followed, and be an advocate for Scrum and related ceremonies
Continuous Improvement Initiatives
Assess overall process and submit ideas to introduce efficiencies that will help improve the process and/or the quality of deliverables
Required Skills and Experience:

5+ years experience in business analysis
Experience working in mixed philosophy (Agile, Waterfall, Iterative etc) software development environment
Excellent communication (written, oral, and listening)
Strong technical, analytical and creative thinking abilities
Good understanding of business processes and rules and how they apply to business success
Exceptional motivation with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Strong presentation and facilitation skills at various levels of the organization
Able to acknowledge, embrace, and adapt easily to change
Able to quickly learn new business and technical concepts
Comfortable to work in an open, highly collaborative, fast-pace, ever changing team environment
Work well under pressure to meet specific deadlines


Nice to have:

Degree or equivalent in an IT-related discipline
Business analyst certification such as CBAP or PMI-PBA


These roles would be up to 6 months, subject to extension. Contract rates vary between $80-100/hour depending on experience.

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Logistics Strategy Analyst position, located in Toronto. This position may require up to 10% travel.
Johnson & Johnson Deliver group, is part of Johnson & Johnson’s global Supply Chain organization supporting operations across all of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Deliver strives to deliver an exceptional customer experience through leading critical customer-facing-functions such as customer service, distribution and transportation. In addition, Deliver oversees critical business enablers, including how we gather and manage supply chain master data, safe and secure supply chain practices, product identification standards, and market/channel access capabilities. It supports all three sectors of Johnson & Johnson: Medical Devices (including Vision), Pharmaceutical, and Consumer Products. Located in every region of the world where Johnson & Johnson operates, Deliver is a critical component of our supply chain, working collaboratively to ensure that quality, safety and the experience of our customers is our top priority.
Within the Deliver Team, the Logistics Strategy Analyst takes a lead role in analytics, development and implementation of key customer logistics improvements and initiatives. Using business intelligence tools and ERP systems to identify performance and growth opportunities through detailed analysis, providing recommendations on policy and process improvements, partnering with key stakeholders to deliver against corporate strategies. This is a dynamic role within an opportunity rich organization!
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for the development and continuous improvement of metrics, as well as metric and service reporting
Partner with internal and external key stakeholders to support process improvements and achieve efficiencies, developing joint value creation strategies
Identify, evaluate and share opportunities across teams, through analysis of business trends, customer data and process application, prepare and present business cases to support efforts
Leads or supports special projects as assigned by Manager, representing Deliver and Pharma strategies
Builds analytics capabilities with team, through tool development and training, engagement on application of analytical process

Qualifications

A University / Bachelor’s degree is required
A minimum of 2 years work experience is required
Proficiency in advanced Excel, Power Point and Word in a Windows Environment is required
Strong technical knowledge with experience using systems and analytical tools such as SAP, Tableau, data base management, business intelligence tools, ability to quickly learn other customer specific proprietary systems is required
Strong interpersonal and collaborative proficiencies, proven ability to nurture relationship in a highly matrixed environment is required
Previous experience in analytical role is preferred
Forecasting, Planning, Winshuttle experience will be an asset
Strong communication and presentation skills
Other:
Significant amount of time will be working on a computer
Some travel between campuses may be required (Markham Area)
